meanings.definition: To sample a smaller portion of a larger sample.
meanings.sent1: I will subsample the candies to taste a few different flavors.
meanings.sent2: Scientists often subsample the soil to study its composition.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to subsample the dishes to create a mini-tasting menu.
meanings.sent4: She enjoys subsampling different genres of music to broaden her musical taste.
meanings.sent5: Subsampling the books on the shelf, she picked out a few to read over the weekend.

meanings.definition: The act of selecting a subset of data for analysis.
meanings.sent1: The subsampling of the survey results provided a representative data set.
meanings.sent2: Researchers use subsampling to reduce the size of the dataset for faster processing.
meanings.sent3: The subsampling of the ice cream flavors made it easier to choose a favorite.
meanings.sent4: In the art class, the teacher used subsampling to focus on specific painting techniques.
meanings.sent5: The subsampling of the photographs helped in creating a concise album of memories.
